Articles.Content:
A flat dry lake on one of Laythes islands would be very useful for operating spaceplanes and especially heavy SSTOs on that moon.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dry_lake

It could basically function as a natural runway and would make landing and taking off much easier than the current bumpy surface.
Seconded. Not to mention, if it's right on the coast, it could be used for constructing your first Laythe Base.
That would be such a good implementation, but also for Duna would it be good as if there was liquid on its surface before, just like Mars.

There's a large mustache shaped island on Laythe at around -0.40,-158.42, the south shore in the middle is pretty flat. Since it's nice and equatorial and the flat part runs east/west it's my goto spaceplane landing spot on Laythe.

Here's a screenshot form kerbalmaps (see my signature)

Edit: Personally i think the ruggedness and lack of land make Laythe more challenging and interesting
Well, there is a reason (once I get a better computer) I will develop an aircraft carrier that I can transport to Laythe.
